- Healing rules
- Character advancement rules
- Optional rules for social status
- Weapon and armor creation and repair rules

57610.name: Glorantha Introduction to the Hero Wars
rpgissuearticle: Review: Glorantha, Introduction to the Hero Wars
57610.description:
From the back cover:

Glorantha is a gigantic cube awash in a limiltess ocean, formed by the collision of four forces in primordal eras. It's a world alive with adventure and magic where gods are plentiful and magic real. The realms of power, spirits, gods, and myth are as tangible as the kingdoms of men. It's the home of heroes and monsters, empires and dragons, and of everyday people trying to preserve their way of life.

In Glorantha a hero makes his name in the mortal sphere; those destined to be great heroes travel the perilous paths of the mythical realm. A hero making his own myth can travel to the distant past to aid or oppose the gods in their battles; journey to the underworld and release the souls of the dead; or bend the wildest demons to his will and arness great magical power.

Our aim is to explain the many people, kingdoms, religions, and gods of Glorantha. It's intended to be both a general introduction to the endlessly fascinating fantasy world of Glorantha and a companion book to the Hero Wars role-playing game. We paint the history and present of Glorantha with broad strokes, occasionally highlighting an interesting feature or person.

57611.name: Wege der Helden
57611.description:
User summary:

Wege der Helden (Ways of the Heroes) contains the Das Schwarze Auge 4th Edition character creation rules.

It includes:

- A character point system for buying attributes and skills
- Character advantages and disadvantages
- The various races and their sub-species and cultures of Aventurien
- Character professions
- Rules for creating additional races and professions
- Lists of character names for the different cultures

57613.name: Das Schwarze Auge Basisregelwerk
57613.description:
User summary:

The Das Schwarze Auge Basisregelwerk (The Dark Eye Basic Rulebook) is a new and expanded edition of the 4th Edition basic rules.

It contains:
- An introduction to role playing
- Twelve pre-generated character archetypes
- Character creation and advancement rules
- Skill mechanics and descriptions
- Combat rules
- Magic rules and spell descriptions
- Rules for damage and healing
- An overview of the continent of Aventurien, its history, regions, and religions
- A bestiary
- Descriptions of poisons and diseases
- Game master advice
- A full-color poster map of Aventurien and a smaller full-color map of Nostria and Andergast
- Two loose character sheets
- Two loose full-color rules summary sheets

57614.name: Dungeon (Issue 59 - May 1996)
57614.description:
Volume X number 5

Cover by Tony Szczudio

Issue quote:
"One for the Dark Lord on his dark throne
In the land of Mordor where the shadows lie."
--J.R.R. Tolkien, The Fellowship of the Ring

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

57615.name: 25 Jahre Das Schwarze Auge: Band I – Die Regeln
57615.description:
User summary:

Band I - Die Regeln (Volume I - The Rules) is a 25th anniversary limited reprint of the contents from the original Abenteuer Basis-Spiel box and the Die Werkzeuge des Meisters box. This includes beginner's rules, advanced rules, a bestiary, a solo adventure, a group adventure.

The back of the book contains a color reprint of the original game master's mask, cardstock miniatures an art print, an A3-map for the group adventure, a character sheet and a combat sheet.

1,000 numbered copies have been printed. The books are bound in black faux-leather.

57616.name: Dungeon (Issue 58 - Mar 1996)
57616.description:
Volume X number 4
(Cover mistakenly reads Volume IX No. 10)

Cover by Ken Meyer, Jr.

This issue does not contain an editorial, and one adventure was missing from the table of contents.

Issue quote:
"Death awaits you with nasty, big, pointy teeth."
--Tim the Wizard

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

57617.name: The Wicked Dead
rpgissuearticle: Night Horrors: The Wicked Dead — Dampyr
57617.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Less than Kindred, more than Kind

Vampires call each other Kindred. Living dead playing at being a big, happy family. But not everything gets invited to the reunion. Some creatures are too grisly, too monstrous, too goddamn strange to be part of the family. These are the vampires that vampires fear. Meet the Wicked Dead.

An Antagonist Book for Vampire: The Requiem

•Details on the Strix, strange nemeses from the nights of Rome
•The horrifying consequences of Kindred sins, including larvae and the Dampyr
•New lineages of vampire, from the horrifying Jiang Shi to the grotesque Cymothoa Sanguinaria

57618.name: Warehouse Railways
57618.description:
Players are CEOs of 5 companies that lay tracks to different cities.
The CEOs wish to make their investments grow but the Board Of Directors of each company oversee the development of their companies. They will intervene if the CEOs do not expand as much as they'd like.

Players will ship oil and coal and bring back steel to the company's warehouse.
Market will dictate the value of the merchandise and make the company's value rise.
Laying track and connecting cities will also make the company's value rise but will also give a bonus to the CEOs.
But beware of merchandise placement: delivery can be taken over by another company!

Each stock in a company gives the right to the CEO of doing one order; if he has 2 or even 3 stock, he does 3 orders.

57620.name: The Unspeakable Oath (Issue 1 - 1990)
57620.description:
Subtitle: A digest of arcane lore for the Call of Cthulhu role-playing game. This inaugural issue sets the worthy pace that continued throughout the Oath's run.

Contents:

* The Dread Page of Azathoth (by John Tynes)
* [Military] Firearms in Call of Cthulhu (by John Crowe)
* Good Tidings From Shantak Claus
* New for Cthulhu
* The Ponape Predators (by Kevin A. Ross)
* The Road to Hali (by John Tynes)
* A Tale of Terror (by Steve Hatherley)
* Creating and Using Mythos Tomes (by John Tynes)
* Within You Without You (by John Tynes)
* Message in a Bottle (by John Tynes)

57622.name: GURPS Power-Ups 2: Perks
57622.description:
From the publisher's website:

"Penny Candy for Your Character!"

"Everybody loves little bonuses for next to nothing. In GURPS, that means Perks -- one point advantages that add just a little edge to your character, and a whole mess 'o flavor. But like sweet treats, can you ever have enough?"

"Sean 'Dr. Kromm' Punch, architect of GURPS Fourth Edition, gathers together dozens of perks from previously published material, including the combat perks from Martial Arts. Power-Ups 2: Perks is your one-stop-shop for one point edges."

"But that's not all! We've expanded on the old perks, making them easier to customize and fit into your character sheet. And then we added dozens more -- over 160 perks in all!"

"For the player looking for a bit of personality to add to his character, or the GM looking for examples to help him create his own campaign specific perks, Power-Ups 2: Perks has the goods."

57623.name: Am Großen Fluss
57623.description:
(user summary)
This sourcebook describes the regions which lie along a river in the continent of Aventurien simply called "Der Große Fluss" (The Great River)
Included are regions which belong to the great Middle Empire (Mittelreich), which are quite conservative and equal Germany in the Middle Ages, and the independent state Albernia, which reminds of England. Moreover, the lands of the fairies, that lie close to Albernia, are also featured.
As always, history, culture, important persons and secrets of the regions are given.

57624.name: Dragon (Issue 71 - Mar 1983)
rpgissuearticle: From the Sorceror's Scroll: New druid spells...naturally!
Game Reviews: Dunzhin cures terminal boredom
Game Reviews: Swordbearer makes lots of sense
Mind of the Monster: Give creatures the brains they were born with
Sage Advice: Solid answers to astral questions
The Blink of a Wizard's Eye
The Deities & Demigods of the World of Greyhawk
Who gets the first swing? Attack Priority system offers more realism without more work
57624.description:
Vol. VII No. 9 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art by Clyde Caldwell.

This issue featured The Taming of Brimstone, the first announced winner in the BOOT HILL category of the Module Design Contest.

57626.name: GURPS Mass Combat
rpgissuearticle: Eidetic Memory - The Knights of the Iron Table
57626.description:
From the publisher's website:

"There Will Be War!"

"Whether you're trying to stop the Dark Lord's invading army, lead a Ranger company against the Axis in WWII, or command your own crack mercenary regiment in a far-flung star empire, you're likely to get into battles that are far too big to resolve with ordinary GURPS combat. GURPS Mass Combat is the answer! It presents a powerful abstract system that lets you resolve land, sea, and air battles at any tech level. Features include:"

"* Rules for logistics, movement, reconnaissance, and many other things that matter to a military force even when no enemy is in sight."

"* Integral treatment of air superiority, amphibious assaults, airborne troops, sieges, and everything else that's important when the enemy is in sight."

"* Round-by-round resolution that puts the commander in control, letting him choose his strategies and instantly see the results of his skill and cunning."

"* Equal attention to the aftermath of battle: pursuit, casualties, looting, recovering losses, and more."

"Everything is fast and easy to use in play thanks to extensive examples, quick-reference tables, and ready-to-go stats for the strength, weaponry, and mobility of numerous unit types. It's all generic, too, covering realistic, fantastic, and superscience troops at every tech level, and providing guidelines for customizing their quality, special training, and equipment. And it never loses sight of the fact that GURPS is a roleplaying game -- every hero gets a chance to shine, and the rules emphasize what the PCs do and what happens to them."

"GURPS Mass Combat requires only the GURPS Basic Set, Fourth Edition."

57627.name: Herz des Reiches
57627.description:
User Summary:
This sourcebook deals with the centre of the great Middle Empire in the continent of Aventurien, calles Mittelreich.
It´s organization reminds of the Holy Roman Empire. This book is about the central province called Garetien, the capital Gareth itself, and the rich south-western province Almada, which equals Spain (including the Arab threat, here called "Novadis".)
As with all sourcebooks, history, culture, important persons and secrets are given.

57628.name: GURPS Martial Arts: Fairbairn Close Combat Systems
57628.description:
From the publisher's website:

"William Ewart 'Dan' Fairbairn was one of the most influential combat instructors of the first half of the 20th century. In his lifetime, he worked with organizations from the international Shanghai Municipal Police to MI-6 to the OSS. He developed combat instruction techniques, SWAT-type tactics, and even his own unarmed combat style. His teaching methods are still in use among law enforcement groups around the world."

"GURPS Martial Arts: Fairbairn Close Combat Systems repeats the details of Fairbairn Close Combat Training (FCCT) from GURPS Martial Arts, but expands the historical information on Fairbairn and his peers, presents Defendu, the original style on which FCCT was based, in full GURPS terms, and introduces a complete style template for Fairbairn-Sykes Handgun Shooting, providing optional rules for using guns in close combat."

"No matter if your character is a detective prowling Shanghai's dangerous docks during the 1920's, an agent infiltrating Nazi Germany during World War II, or a modern SWAT team member, Fairbairn Close Combat Systems has the details you need to kick butt and take down the bad guys!"

57629.name: GURPS Martial Arts: Gladiators
57629.description:
From the introduction:

"The word 'gladiators' immediately conjures up a host of violent images. The net and trident. Fans screaming for blood. Patrician Romans sitting disdainful of the slaves who fight for the crowd’s amusement."

"The world of the gladiator is more than just slaves, swords, and death. Gladiators were well-trained athletes competing in a most lethal sport. They were pampered and cared for like racehorses, driven mercilessly like boot-camp recruits, and then sent out to kill and die splendidly for the crowds."

"GURPS Martial Arts: Gladiators takes you inside the world of the gladiator. You’ll enter the ludus, where raw slaves and desperate freemen were transformed into cunning and artful martial artists. You’ll go inside the arena, where they put on the show they trained for. You’ll travel to the Roman streets and beyond, where gladiators were famed for their fighting skills, envied for their physical prowess, and wooed by their social betters."

"Now enter the arena, where the blood-soaked sand
reveals the skills of some of the most renowned martial
artists in history . . ."

57630.name: Dungeon (Issue 56 - Nov 1995)
rpgissuearticle: The Lane of Men with Tails
57630.description:
Volume X number 2

Cover by Stephen A. Danielle

Issue quote:
Semper alquid de novis ex Africa.
There is always something new out of Africa.
--Pliny the Elder

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

57631.name: Return to Warsaw
57631.description:
From the back cover:

He's back....
Last year, the inhabitants of Warsaw's various communities, with the aid of a few American soldiers, united to defeat the baron. Over the winter, the threat gone, the small communities fell to squabbling among themselves. This spring, the baron's back, with a new army, and once again threatens the communities that have taken root in the ruins of the former capital of Poland. The baron plans to conquer the communities before the winter wheat crop is ready, while the defenders are still short of food.
The characters have been asked for help by Filip Kizysztof, leader of the Sielce settlement. Filip needs the characters' aid in reuniting the splintered communities to defeat the baron a second time, and in the process save what's left of civilisation in this part of Poland.

Return to Warsaw is the first in the Return to Europe series of Twilight: 2000 adventure modules. This series of adventures will take the characters back to the Polish city of Warsaw, east to the city of Lvov in the Ukraine, and then back to Poland again, this time to Silesia. Although the three modules are linked, and designed to be used in sequence, each is an independent adventure in and of itself, and can be played separately.

This booklet contains:


Revised streetmaps of the relevant portions of downtown Warsaw.
Updated histories of the Warsaw communities and the baron.
Orders of battle for the various combatants, including the remnants of the Soviet 10th Guards Tank Division.
Information for adapting the larger battles for resolution using Last Battle, GDW's new boardgame of modern and future close combat.

57632.name: Grendel
57632.description:
From the publisher's website:

"The terraforming of Mars continues, with the inevitability of a giant machine rolling across the red dust of Sol's fourth planet . . . but there are still those who would like nothing more than to throw a planet-sized monkey wrench into that machine. The ecoterrorists (or preservationists, depending on your point of view) of Red Mars usually like their sabotage loud, flashy, and destructive - but this time they're trying something subtle. Can your Mars Defense Force team figure out who's the saboteur at the research station on the Hellas icecap - and where else their plans may lead? 'Grendel' is written by Jim Cambias, author of GURPS Mars."

57633.name: White Eagle
57633.description:
From the back cover:

"Don't tell me, let me guess. We have to save western civilization again, right?"
We all thought Ski was crazy. "We are the last hope of civilization in Poland," he said. "Julian is a dictator. Krakow is run by a bunch of gouging, mercantile profiteers. There are bandits everywhere, and the only one who cares about the Polish people is Father Wojiech. We have to help him - it's the only way to keep everything from sliding into the pit."
All of us in the squad argued for hours. I said helping Father Wojiech is insane and is only gonna get us all killed. We should hole up somewhere and see what the situation is in the spring.
So who are we linked up with? Guess.

In White Eagle, powerful forces are struggling to control a nation. The armed might of King Julian of Silesia is matched against the equally powerful economic forces of the free city of Krakow. Opposing them both is the Wojsko Ludowa (People's Army) of Father W. Niekarz. Krakow has mercantile connections. money, and technological expertise. The "king" has military expertise and a steadily expanding government of local warlords backed by an organized military. Father Niekarz and his followers have a devout belief in the righteousness of their cause, a burning desire to see Poland free of tin-pot dictators and petty warlords backed by "soldiers" who are nothing more than bandits - and the Black Madonna of Czestochowa, a religious icon and a powerful symbol of Polish nationalism.
For the WL's banner, Father Niekarz has chosen a white eagle (the tradional symbol of Poland) on a red field (red and white are the Polish national colors). The People's Army has no stockpiles of weapons and ammunition, no vast treasury, no great military leaders. That's where you come in....

White Eagle outlines what has happened in southern Poland since the players last saw the region: the transmutation of General Julian Filipowitz into the despotic King Julian, the power struggle within Krakow for control of the region's industrial economy, the deteriorating agricultural situation that threatens to spark another round of civil unrest within the towns and villages of Poland - these factors and others threaten the fragile blossom of civilisation.

57634.name: Rescue Mission
57634.description:
From the publisher's website:

"The Chinese research outpost called Minotaur Station has gone silent . . . and in the early days of Mars exploration, everybody planetside helps everybody else, because they're all you've got for several hundred million miles. But why are the Chinese rescuers so hostile? And just where did everybody go?"

"Rescue Mission is an adventure for the 'Domed Mars' setting in GURPS Mars, and it's written by GURPS Mars author Jim Cambias. Can you solve the mystery and watch your back in an environment so unforgiving that the tiniest mistake could kill?"

57635.name: Animonde
57635.description:
Designed by the noted French designer Croc, and drawing on the themes in "La Planete Oubliee" by M. Leinster, Animonde is a fantasy RPG set in a world without metal, and where animals and humans have a harmonious, symbiotic relationship. The game is intended to be non-violent, with the players using persuasion and intimidation instead of direct violence (although it is possible).

Written in French, with a very poetic, idyllic, fantastic world, and derived from Croc's previous RPG Bitume, Animonde was published by Siroz in 1988, and it's non-violent approach was in stark contrast to the hack & slash genres dominating the market, leading to an inevitable cancellation of the game.

- user summary -

57636.description:
Querni is a two-player abstract strategy game played on a 10×7 board. The goal is to remove all your numbered pieces (1-16) from the board. The catch is that you can only remove numerically consecutive chains of pieces, and the chains must be at least three in length. Turns involve moving a piece (one adjacent step, or one or more jumps) and/or removing a chain.

Awards
2009 Winner - Concurso de diseño Granollers - Fira JugarxJugar

Online Play

http://www.querni.com/
57636.name: Querni

57637.name: Dungeon (Issue 55 - Sep 1995)
57637.description:
Volume X number 1

Cover by Tony DiTerlizzi

Issue quote:
"It is not down on any map; true places never are."
--Herman Melville, Moby Dick

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

57638.name: MacGuffin Alphabet
57638.description:
From the publisher's website:

"T is for the Twisted Mind of Stefan Jones . . ."

"Twenty-six ways to get get into and out of trouble in a variety of space age and later settings! Whether it involves deciphering intelligence reports disseminated in comic books or being brainwashed by the most comfortable bed in the world, you'll find over two dozen good excuses to torment your players within."

"A MacGuffin is an object of desire for someone, somewhere - perhaps they only wish to purchase it, but more likely they're willing to lie, steal, and murder to acquire it. Most MacGuffins are plot filler to justify the action, but these are interesting."

"If you want a mysterious aristocrat to hire a small team to 'acquire' a copy of a musical meme hazard; if one of the heroes has found a pretty trinket that's going to start a war the next time he's seen wearing it in public; if you just want to mess with their heads . . . try the MacGuffin Alphabet!"

57639.name: GURPS Locations: The Tower of Octavius
57639.description:
From the publisher's website:

"The Tower of Octavius -- is this mysterious fortress a foreboding place of knowledge, a place of dread requiring brave heroes to cleanse, or a base of operations for a band of adventurers and their unusual patron?"

"That's up to you."

"Locations: The Tower of Octavius is a complete kit for incorporating this mighty stronghold and its occupants into your GURPS fantasy campaign, including suggestions for setting it on Yrth. Along with 10 pages of maps, the book features a detailed description of the six-level tower, plus its basement, dungeon, and crypt, and the region around the wizard's tower. It provides full GURPS information on its powerful, eccentric occupant -- Octavius of Tyrvo, the Wizard-Baron -- and his minions and allies. You'll also find plenty of ideas for how to add this ominous abode to your campaign, as a one-shot place to visit and perhaps overcome, a recurring point of interest, or the basis of an adventure series."

"All these secrets are revealed in GURPS Locations: The Tower of Octavius; whether those secrets will be uncovered in your game is another mystery."

57640.name: GURPS Locations: Metro of Madness
57640.description:
From the publisher's website:

"On the streets above, humanity serves as the pulsing blood that flows through the city, keeping it alive and vibrant."

"Below the streets is a separate pulse . . . one that beats just as loudly, echoing in the darkness."

"Welcome to Samuel Luke Subway Station."

"GURPS Locations: Metro of Madness describes an unusual subway station where the shadows harbor strange secrets, the daily routine masks strange happenings, and nothing is as it seems. From troglodytes to trapped spirits, from monsters hiding in plain sight to mysteries hidden in the architecture, from animal empaths to sinister psychopaths, the Metro of Madness bubbles over with adventure possibilities:"

"* Maps for all three levels of the station."

"* Templates for people likely to be found around the station, including urban explorers, pickpockets, cultists, and serial killers!"

"* More than dozen noteworthy NPCs tied to the area, who might cross heroes' paths for good or ill."

"* Descriptions of the unique supernatural threats and phenomena of the station, including spirits of the subway, mural wisps, and a chthonic demon."

"* Spells related to subways and their stations, and a completely new form of magic: rail shamanism."

"* Campaign and adventure ideas for incorporating the Metro of Madness into a variety of settings, from cyberpunk and supers to steampunk and In Nomine."

"Have your tickets ready . . . for madness!"

57641.name: Dungeon (Issue 54 - Jul 1995)
57641.description:
Volume IX number 6

Cover by David O. Miller

Issue quote:
"Corruptio Optimi Pessima"
The best when corrupted is the worst

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

57642.name: Terminus V
57642.description:
From the back of the book:

T5 gives you the opportunity to take part in a unique combat simulation set in the mostly unexplored and devastated future, where earth has witnessed four prior world wars and life is primarily spent on survival. Countries go to war over water and food. Paper and coin monies are unknown-with bartering being commonly accepted and "currency credits" taking the place of traditional money exchange. once again, the seas and oceans are largely untamed and ruled by pirates. the skies never see human flight as it was once known. worldwide population is cut by over two-thirds. Earth is reduced to a savage and primal state with new multinational borders. Cached old technology comes back and new "futuristic" technology is limited and held at the highest and most top secret "black" levels. Scientists are typically regarded as the most important life forms on the planet and must be protected-and retained-at all costs, for they may very well be the saviors of the human race.

You can play T5 as a traditional tabletop miniatures wargame or roleplay as one of the characters - or both simultaneously - while you explore this sanguinary new earth. if you prefer, you can have the game run by a game master igm), or have it run on its own with all the players filling the role as gm and having a say in the course of the action-no more waiting for someone to run the game for you.

Your mission awaits...

This 422 page Master Rulebook is packed with all the rules and information you need to play both miniatures and role playing games.

You will find:

- A complete easy-to-use game system with all the charts and tables you need. Plus, numerous explanations and examples throughout the rules.
- An armory with over IOO different weapons, ammo, scopes, body armor, and more.
- Pages of miscellaneous gear, equipment, and supplies of all types, including uniquely specialized and extremely rare high-tech Exotic Gear.
- Over 60 vehicles including tanks. IFVs. APCs. military transport, scout and armored cars, boats and assault watercraft, mini-subs, and conventional transport.
- Rules for creating and maintaining characters, including Quick Roll-Up Guides and QuickCreate Arrays, scenarios, fog of war. armies, weather, logistics. PC experience, scalable victory points system, victory conditions, and time tracking.
- A detailed timeline, plus major personalities, armies, and current world history.

57644.name: GURPS Loadouts: Monster Hunters
rpgissuearticle: Monster Hunter Firepower at the Movies
Random Thought Table: Threats Great, Small, and Unexpected
57644.description:
From the publisher's website:

"When sinister forces assemble and speed is of the essence, those who stand against the darkness don't have time to go shopping. These brave souls need GURPS Loadouts: Monster Hunters."

"This book contains ready-to-go packages of gear -- weapons, protection, and equipment -- from GURPS High-Tech, GURPS High-Tech: Pulp Guns, Volume 1, and Pulp Guns, Volume 2 (which are required to make full use of this book). Loadouts are designed for heroic roles at two different budgets and in two eras. All packages are complete, so getting locked and loaded is as simple as picking the gear that fits your budget and weight allowance. And each loadout includes lenses for further customization. Whether you're a slayer, scout, or sage . . . in TL6 or TL8 . . . on a budget or money is no object, this book has what you need:"

"* Optional rules for gear and guns, including new rules for those wanting more oomph from existing ammunition. (When you're in a monster movie, bigger ammo is better!)"

"* A selection of new weapons and equipment that are especially useful for those who hunt creatures of the night."

"* A 13-page appendix of equipment lists, with the information formatted so that it's ready to print and include with your own character sheets."

"Let the forces of darkness cling to the shadows -- now you've got the flashlight and flares to find them, the right weapons to take them down, and the chalk to draw outlines of the bodies."

57645.name: Lands Out of Time
57645.description:
From the publisher's website:

"Humans and dinosaurs go together like gamers and pizza. That tens of millions of years separated the last of the dinosaurs from the first of the humans is a mere inconvenience, easily ignored. GURPS Lands Out of Time is a sourcebook for human/dino adventuring, providing all you need to know to place man and giant reptile side-by-side, whether it's a 'Lost World' adventure, caveman slapstick, or something in between. GURPS Lands Out of Time is an e23 original game setting for GURPS Fourth Edition."

57646.name: Griswald Grimm's Little Shop of Poisons and Potions
57646.description:
[Back cover]
IN THIS VOLUME
30 POISONS AND POTIONS FOR EVERYDAY USE

Have you ever heard of TOADYTOXIN? Do you know what happens when you drink a vial of VELVET #9? Would you know what to do with a bottle of FOLLOW ME POWDER? This volume of GRISWALD GRIMM'S LITTLE SHOP OF POISONS AND POTIONS has the answers to these and many other important questions of a chemical nature. There's WEREWOLF POWDER, DRAGONFIRE, TIGER LILY, PUFF ADDER VENOM, GRAYEARTH, DEMONSBANE, MILK OF HUMAN KINDNESS GUMDROPS, WHITEFORE and much much more -- 30 poisons and potions that do everthing from turning a victim to stone to bursting him/it into flames! And THAT'S JUST IN THE FIRST SECTION!!!

THE MAGIC USER'S KIT BAG
Every magic user has certain formulas which he cannot do without. Such useful chemical agents as ELF SNEEZE POTION or DETECT EVIL PRESENCE POTION have always been useful to the wizard on the go. Now comes THE MAGIC USER'S KIT BAG. 30 potions costing less than 1000 GP per potion. Names like DROP DEAD POTION and ENHANCE LOCKPICKING POTION, CREATE LIGHTNING POTION and POLYMORPH TO BIRD POTION are enough to give any magic user shivers of excitement.

UNFORSEEN SIDE EFFECTS
Ever have a spell go awry? UNFORSEEN SIDE EFFECTS is the ultimate slipup chart, a matrix for 30, 6, 10 and 12 sided dice for everything from turning green to dropping dead as a tackon to the use of unpredictable substances.

PLUS A PREVIOUSLY UNPUBLISHED ORIGINAL LINDA TIERNAN SHORT STORY, DRAGON MEDIC, REVEALING FOR THE FIRST TIME, THE REAL GRISWALD GRIMM!

57647.description:
Do you have what it takes to captain a starship in combat? Check out the fast-paced space ship combat game Dog Fight: Starship Edition.

This customizable sci-fi tactical/strategy game is as much about moving on the board as it is the cards you choose. You have simple actions to choose from and without the need of an RPG scoresheet you can manage your crew, your weapons, movement and your ship's special abilities. With 52 cards in each starter deck, choose your ship, chase down your opponents and see if you can out Captain the enemy.

In Dog Fight: Starship Edition each player controls only one ship rather than a fleet of ships or horde of characters. For 2 or more players. Three levels of game play, booster packs available. Each deck set (starter and deluxe) is designed for one player only; your opponents need their own decks.

Sample Turn:

Each player performs 3 actions, which are either drawing a card, setting a card face down or passing. Player A has priority in this example.

Action Phase 1
For this turn Player A sets 3 cards face down, which uses his/her 3 tiers. Player B does the same.

Action Phase 2
Player A's tier 1 card is flipped face up and resolves. Player B's tier 1 card is flipped face up and resolves. Tiers 2 and 3 continue in this pattern.

Action Phase 3
All cards played that do not last are discarded to the discard pile.
Priority player may draw 1 card from his/her deck for free.

End of Round.
57647.name: Dog Fight: Starship Edition

57648.name: Lair of the Fat Man
57648.description:
From the publisher's website:

"Every so often, there comes an adventure so grim and gritty, so revolutionary, and so serious that it elevates the super-spy thriller genre to new levels of sophistication."

"GURPS Lair of the Fat Man is not that adventure."

"This espionage tale, set in the early 1980s, pits the heroes against each other as part of a multinational team called UNISTOMP. Can these super-spies trust each other and their cohorts' nations enough to save the world, protect their countries' secrets, and learn the truth about the Fat Man? GURPS Lair of the Fat Man is an oddball romp through super-spy cliches, in the style of 1960s espionage films that don't take themselves too seriously."

"This scenario includes five pages of maps of the Fat Man's lair (plus ancillary maps), full information about the Fat Man's plans, and GURPS stats for the Fat Man's henchmen. It provides lots of helpful advice for running this tale, including details about how to keep things from getting too silly, ideas for sequels or making this part of an ongoing campaign, and alternate possibilities for the Fat Man's curious secret . . . including suggestions for making it more or less realistic!"

"If double agents, brainwashed "zombies," and a flamethrower brassiere are your cup of tea (or glass of martini), then GURPS Lair of the Fat Man is for you!"

57649.name: GURPS Psionic Powers
57649.description:
[Back cover]

The Power of the Mind

If you want psychic powers but don't feel like using GURPS Powers to build them, you're in luck! GURPS Psionic Powers does all the work for you, crafting advantages and modifiers into ready-to-go abilities for espers, telepaths, and other psis. This one-stop shop for mental mastery includes:


Notes on how existing advantages and modifiers behave when used to build psi abilities, plus many entirely new modifiers.
Stats and descriptions for over 100 psi abilities, from classics like Clairvoyance and Levitation to weirdness like Mold Flesh and Netrunning — many offered in levels, making it easy to fine-tune individual power.
More than 70 new perks for psis.
Optional rules for psionic skills and techniques, allowing psis to get tricky with individual abilities or feats without being broadly talented.
Ten complete psionic power groups: Anti-Psi, Astral Projection, Ergokinesis, ESP, Probability Alteration, Psychic Healing, Psychic Vampirism, Psychokinesis, Telepathy, and Teleportation.
Rules for using psi, including detection, extra effort, and linking minds into a "gestalt."
Options, variants, and advice on custom abilities and powers.


You can use these elements individually or wholesale, confident that they're entirely compatible with the GURPS Basic Set, Fourth Edition and GURPS Powers.

GURPS Psionic Powers requires the GURPS Basic Set, Fourth Edition. GURPS Powers is recommended but not required.

57650.name: GURPS Infinite Worlds: Collegio Januari
57650.description:
From the publisher's website:

"GURPS Infinite Worlds describes Infinity Unlimited, a mega-corporation that uses high technology to cross between parallel worlds."

"But what if the world-jumpers were not technicians, but wizards? What if Janus himself, the god of doorways, shared the spells and rituals needed to break through the quantum walls? The answer: Collegio Januari. It's a powerful guild of wizards, piercing the veil between their world and others, searching for knowledge, wealth . . . and mana."

"Written by Kenneth Hite, this campaign setting brings world-hopping to the traditional fantasy genre. It can be dropped into either a GURPS Infinite Worlds or GURPS Fantasy campaign, and can be easily adapted to any low-tech game featuring wizards and knights."

57651.name: Underdark Adventure Guide
57651.description:
[Back cover]
The Underdark Adventure Guide is a world-neutral, standalone guide to adventuring in the strange, alien world of the underdark. The underdark is far more than just dungeons and caves. It is a veritable underground continent, populated by advanced civilizations, ancient ruins, sunless seas, alien magic, bizarre creatures, and the horrid denizens of the gloom. The standards of the surface world hold no sway in the underdark, and its mysteries, ferocity, and danger will challenge even the hardiest of adventurers.

Underdark adventures are easy to integrate with an existing campaign, as the very nature of the underdark lends itself to layering -- simply arrange for the discovery of a subterranean portal, and the land beneath your existing campaign has a new life. The Underdark Adventure Guide includes everything you need to create a compelling underdark campaign:


New character options for underdark explorers, ranging from new feats and adventuring gear to prestige classes specially tailored to the underdark races: drow, derro, duergar, svirfneblin, and troglodytes.
More than a dozen new monsters native to the underdark, plus a variety of specialized plants and bizarre funguses.
Extensive guidelines and world-building advice for constructing your own underdark region.
A dozen fully developed points of interest. You can use these piecemeal as drop-in locations in your existing campaign, or use them together as a fully-developed, integrated underdark region.

57652.name: GURPS Hot Spots: Renaissance Florence
57652.description:
From the publisher's website:

"Intrigue and politics. Artistry and adventure. Festivals and food. Welcome to the center of the world -- Florence!"

"Hot Spots: Renaissance Florence is your tour guide through one of the most exhilarating locations in history, the cradle of the most explosive intellectual and artistic era the world has seen. Florence! For fans of history, the name conjures dozens of adventure possibilities; those with only a dim memory from a long-ago classroom have yet to know of the city's mystique. This book is designed to cater to both groups -- scholars and neophytes alike will find themselves enlightened."

"No mere travelogue, Hot Spots: Renaissance Florence has been designed for gamers first. Mostly generic (with a smattering of GURPS information), it's full of useful and interesting information -- history, notable people, places of interest, laws and politics -- that makes the city come alive for roleplayers. Each section also contains one or more adventure seeds that can turn those facts into encounters that will immerse heroes in Florence's charms and intrigues, while a detailed 'Campaigns' chapter gives ideas for how to work the city into an ongoing game . . . including many unusual ways to incorporate Florence into other settings!"

"With Hot Spots: Renaissance Florence, history isn't just something to be read about -- it's waiting to be made."

57653.name: Lethal Legacies: Traps of the World Before
57653.description:
[Back cover]
In the elder times, before the dawn of man or even the first birth of elves, an ancient civilization was widely distributed across the world. Now they are long gove, but they left behind a lethal legacy. Their tombs and ruins are filled with the deadliest of traps, many using techno-magical powers not understood by modern scholars. This handbook examines 60 of the devious, deadly traps left behind by this mysterious civilization, with complete d20 stats for each.

57654.name: GURPS High Tech Pulp Guns, Volume 1
rpgissuearticle: Air Devils of the South Seas
57654.description:
From the publisher's website:

"During the iconic years of the pulp era -- the Roaring Twenties and the Thrilling Thirties -- action stories featured hard-boiled detectives and beautiful dames, investigators of the supernatural, masked vigilantes, and cliffhanging adventurers. No matter their opponent, setting, or genre, they all carried heaters, rods, or gats."

"High-Tech: Pulp Guns, Volume 1 catalogs the handguns, shotguns, and submachine guns common to the two-fisted heroes and fiendish villains of the day. Outfit gangsters and G-men, big-game hunters and brutal henchmen with pistols, shotguns, and even the infamous 'Tommy Gun.' Arm your adventurers for Cliffhangers campaigns, Horror games, or even Prohibition-era Supers and Mysteries!"

57655.name: GURPS High Tech Pulp Guns, Volume 2
rpgissuearticle: Air Devils of the South Seas
57655.description:
From the publisher's website:

"The two-fisted heroes of the Roaring Twenties and the Thrilling Thirties were hard-boiled detectives and beautiful dames, investigators of the supernatural, masked vigilantes, and other gun-toting adventurers. And when their foes were to big to put down with fists or pistols, they weren't shy about bringing out the really big stuff."

"High-Tech: Pulp Guns, Volume 2 covers infantry rifles, machine guns, cannon, grenades, and even flamethrowers! In addition to the military hardware, the book also describes many hunting and gallery rifles, flare pistols, and similar civilian arms. Lock and load for a World War II campaign, or any Cops or military action in the '20s and '30s!"

57656.name: GURPS High-Tech Weapon Tables
57656.description:
From the publisher's website:

"While GURPS High-Tech covers all aspects of life in TL5-8, the most referenced section is always the weapons. Should your character carry a Walther P38 or Franchi SPAS-12? What's the weight of the mook's unloaded Enfield Sten Mk II? Can the team pick up an anti-tank weapon for less than $500?"

"For these common questions, you don't need to flip through the entire chapter; you just want the weapon tables. And that's why we created GURPS High-Tech: Weaponry Tables. All the raw data you need, in 18 easy to reference pages."

"Note: this product is bundled with the PDF version of GURPS High-Tech; if you have already purchased that product, you do not need to purchase this one."

57658.name: Dungeon (Issue 53 - May 1995)
57658.description:
Volume IX number 5

Cover by William O'Connor

Issue quote:
"All that is gold does not glitter,
not all those who wander are lost."
--J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

57659.name: The Book of LARP
57659.description:
[Back cover]
What is Live Action Roleplaying?
How does it work?
How is it different from other forms of roleplaying?
How can I run a LARP of my own?

The Book of LARP is here to answer all of your questions. Whether you're just curious about the hobby, looking to run your first LARP, or are a veteran LARPer, The Book of LARP is for you.

The Book of LARP has ten articles jam-packed with information on writing and running a LARP, from creating the world, to writing the characters, to adding atmosphere to your game, to being the best game master you can be, articles written by experienced LARP authors from across the globe! If you've never run a LARP before, The Book of LARP is full of tips and tricks to make your LARPs even better!

The Book of LARP has six complete demo games - two-hour LARPs - each designed to be run one night for your friends (4-8 players). These games are designed to use the Rules To Live By(tm) LARP System, and everthing you need to know to run these LARPs is here in this book.

The Book of LARP - Because everyone needs to Live!

57660.description:
Time's Up! Blue is a charades-based party game for teams of two or more players (and is best with teams of two). Before the game begins, each player looks at several cards featuring famous historical or fictional characters and chooses some of them. Each player's cards are shuffled to form a deck, and this deck is used for each of the game's three rounds.

In each round, team members take turns trying to get their teammates to guess as many names as possible in 30 seconds. In round 1, almost any kind of clue is allowed, and the cluegiver cannot pass on a card. In round 2, no more than one word can be used in each clue (but unlimited sounds and gestures are permitted); the cluegiver can pass on any card he likes, and the teammates can give only a single answer. In round 3, the cluegiver can use no words at all and can pass as often as he likes; again, teammates are allowed only a single guess. Give good physical clues in round 1, and they'll pay dividends down the road when you need to keep your mouth shut and gesture like a maniac before time's up!
57660.name: Time's Up! Edición Azul

57661.name: Dungeon (Issue 52 - Mar 1995)
57661.description:
Volume IX number 4

Cover by Scott Burdick

Issue quote:
"O brave new world,
that has such people in't!"
--William Shakespeare, The Tempest

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

57662.name: Battle of Dark Age Britain
57662.description:
The game is designed for students of college-level classes in which the history of Dark Age Britain is addressed. These could include classes in medieval or ancient British history or classes in Arthurian literature. The game may also appeal to anyone with an interest in British history, including Arthurian enthusiasts, and members of the general wargaming/Diplomacy crowd.

The richest and strongest player or player alliance wins the game. "Victory points" are calculated by factoring in a player-king's wealth (cash-on-hand), the economic value of the lands he owns, the combat strength of his warbands, and "glory points" accumulated for killing opposition kings and princes in combat. Thus, the victorious player-king is the one most reknown for his wealth, combat prowess, and political/military power.

57664.name: Body Link
57664.description:
Bodylink attempts to help students learn to integrate their knowledge of the various components of human physiology. These components, body parts, body systems, and body processes are often taught as independent units. In reality, they comprise an intricate pattern of interlocking relationships. No single entity stands alone. Instead, each entity has a multitude of connections to other entities and systems. The game is designed to graphically display this web of relationships. Body parts are linked to related body processes, grouped with common system entities, and connected to other body parts

Players attempt to gain points by grouping together tiles of body parts and body activities according to physiological relationships.

57665.name: Bumper Car Rally
57665.description:
The game is designed to be played during or after a instructional unit dealing with motion. This game could also be used during a unit considering Newton's laws, primarily the law of inertia. It could also be used during a unit involving momentum and its conservation and elastic and inelastic collisions.

The objective of the game is to be the first player to reach the opposite side of the game board.

57666.name: Budgetown
57666.description:
This board game would be used after a unit of study on consumer awareness and financial life skills. Discussions would precede the playing of the game and a debriefing would follow.

The object of the game is to pay all of your budget card amounts, collect your receipt tokens and have money left to go to Central Park and cash out.

57667.name: Dungeon (Issue 49 - Sep 1994)
57667.description:
Volume IX number 1

Cover by Paul Jaquays

Issue quote:
"The setting sun, and music at the close,
As the last taste of sweets, is sweetest last,
Writ in remembrance, more than things long past."
--William Shakespeare, King Richard II, Act II, Scene 1

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

57668.name: Warlord: Necropolis Faction Book
57668.description:
Necropolis: Thule, Realm of the Restless Dead is a 48-page booklet designed to provide you with the edge you need.

An insiders account of the Necropolis itself
Iinsight into the Thulian Lord's plan for Taltos
Tips for using the Necropolis as antagonists and allies in RPGs
Data Cards for new Models
New rules for the basic necropolis army, including New Equipment and New Spells
A new Sub-list - The Crypt Legion with its own rules and special powers
A New Scenario especially suited for Necropolis forces
A tutorial on how to make your own sand table
And More!

57669.name: Blustery Day
57669.description:
The board game allows the players to apply their knowledge of directions on a map setting. Players will practice moving auxiliary pieces appropriately while "collecting lost toys." The type of board used here is similar to "battlefield" type games.

Object of the game To collect as many toys as possible before the timer goes off rollin 2 dice: numeral die & direction die.

57671.name: Nuts and Bolts of the Big Six
57671.description:
This game is designed to reinforce The Big Six, an informational and problem solving technique developed by Mike Eisenberg and Bob Berkowitz. The Big Six consists of six separate tasks, which help students focus research, solve problems and make decisions. The players must have received instruction in The Big Six before playing this game.

The board game consists of a series of questions which players need to answer correctly in order to score points and cycle through the Big Six process twice. The game board is divided into six areas that represent each step. These areas are flanked by "rooms" which occupy the four corners of the board. The rooms describe locations in which Big Six activities typically take place: the Classroom, the Library Media Center, the Home, and the Group Study (where students might work collaboratively on projects).

The game is a linear race game which continues until all the players have finished. The first player to finish is not necessarily the winner. Nuts and Bolts has been designed to reward understanding the Big Six more than the roll of the die. Those players who have answered questions most deftly accrue the greatest number of points. The winner is determined when the last player has completed the second round.

57672.name: Warlord: Reven Army Book
57672.description:
Reven: The Great Reven is a 48-page booklet designed to provide you with the edge you need.

Includes an insiders account of the Monglash Steppes
Insight into the Khakhan's plan for Taltos
Tips for using the Reven as antagonists and allies in RPGs
Data Cards for new Models
New rules for the basic Reven army, including New Equipment and New Spells
2 new Sub-lists - The Legion Tomukh and Legion Noghra with their own rules and special powers
2 New Scenarios especially suited for Reven forces
A primer on the language of the Reven - Manu Kele
And More!

57673.description: The famous Monopoly game of the Dutch City Utrecht. Buy, sell and trade streets in the expansive streets of Utrecht.
57673.name: Monopoly: Utrecht

57674.description: The famous Monopoly game. In this version you can buy, sell and trade property of the Dutch capital Amsterdam.
57674.name: Monopoly: Amsterdam

57675.description: This book provides with all the information that you need to play the Crusaders faction in the Warlord miniatures game.
57675.name: Warlord: Crusaders Army Book

57676.description: The famous Monopoly game. In this version you can buy, sell and trade the property of the Belgium city Antwerpen.
57676.name: Monopoly: Antwerpen

57677.name: Warlord: Nefsokar Army Book
57677.description: The Nefsokar army book will contain 64 pages of new spells, equipment, data cards for new models, and fluff detailing the Nefsokar and their rich history. Also included will be a complete section dedicated to role playing using the Nefsokar as heroes or antagonists and a new sublist of the Nefsokar - People of the Desert Wind. This all Khamsin sublist will have its own special rules and powers.

57678.description: The famous Monopoly game. In this version you can buy, sell and trade the property of the Belgium capital Brussel.
57678.name: Monopoly: Brussel

57679.name: Warlord: Overlords Army Book
57679.description:
From the black city of Craclaw they ride, spreading oppression and fear, binding all who oppose them in the chains of slavery. Only internal stride and civil war ha held them in check thus far, but time is changing. The modern Overlords are no longer simple slavers, but true despots in the making. A sadistic priestess, a military genius and a renegade Lichlord, these would be tyrants have put aside their petty difference to work together toward their common goal: total domination of Taltos. As that wasn't enough, the arrival of the Inquisitors from the Empire of Malvernis can only be seen as a ill omen for the future of Taltos.

This book includes:
• An insider's account of the city of Craclaw and the power struggles within.
• Tips for playing or using the Overlords in RPG's.
• New data cards for new models.
• New rules for the default Overlords Army.
• New equipment.
• New spells - including a new type of Cleric Magic - Khardullian Magic.
• The Overlords sublist - The Onyx Legion.
• The Overlords sublist - Followers of Khardullis.

57680.description: The famous Monopoly game. It is published in order of the 25 year existence of the company Carglass. You can buy, sell and trade the companies Carglass in this edition.
57680.name: Monopoly: Carglass

57681.name: Monopoly: Hoeksche Waard
57681.description: The famous Monopoly game. In this version you can buy, sell and trade property in the Dutch region of Hoeksche Waard.

57682.name: Monopoly: Morris Unilever Corporate Strategy Game
57682.description: The famous Monopoly game, made in order of the company Unilever. You can buy, sell and trade company divisions. Only 500 copies were made of this edition. The paws are U shaped figures like the company logo.

57683.description: The famous Monopoly game. This version is made for the dutch organisation of road transfer and haulage. You can buy, sell and trade roads.
57683.name: Monopoly: Transport en Logistiek

57684.name: Demand of Honor
rpg: Star Trek: The Role Playing Game (FASA)
57684.description:
From the back of the book:

"Although the Federation and the Gorn Alliance have concluded a treaty, a band of renegade Gorn ships have been raiding Federation shipping. This threatens to jeopardize the peace. The Gorn have told Star Fleet the location of the planet where the renegades have their base. Your destroyer, the USS Hastings, has been dispatched to carry a Gorn Ambassador to meet with the renegades. It seems like a normal mission, but the Ambassador turns out to be none other than the Gorn Captain who fought with Capt. James T. Kirk of the Enterprise. He brings aboard with him a squad of 'bodyguards.' Your Security chief senses that something isn't quite right...

Recommended for up to 9 players. Possible pre-generated PCs and vessel details (including deck plans) included."

57685.name: The Vanished
rpg: Star Trek: The Role Playing Game (FASA)
57685.description:
From the back of the book:

"The crew of the USS Enterprise must find out why the crew of Federation Deepspace Research Facility 39 have suddenly disappeared in mid-conversation - before they too are among The Vanished!

Recommended for 6 players using familiar characters from the classic 'Star Trek' TV series. Includes FDR Facility 39 details and deck plans, and Tournament notes."

rpg: Star Trek: The Role Playing Game (FASA)
57686.name: Star Trek Gamemaster's Kit
57686.description:
From the back of the book:

"The STAR TREK GAMEMASTER'S KIT includes the following:

3-panel Gamemaster's Screen displaying all important tables and charts;
16-page booklet of all the tables and charts needed by players and gamemasters, including character sheets for Star Fleet personnel, Klingons, merchant characters, and much more."

57687.name: Nuggets Fantasy Toolkit
57687.description:
Publisher's description:

A self-contained guide to implementing the simple NUGGET system for the fantasy genre.

Contains:


The NUGGET rules reprinted in a more reader-friendly format.
Races - general framework and common fantasy examples like elf and dwarf.
Common Special Abilities for fantasy creatures.
Lists of occupations and skills for inspiration.
Magic - fleshed out rules using individual spells and wider Spheres.
Gear and Loot - wealth, simple trading rules and magic items in two pages.
A sample setting in two pages.
Monsters - five pages of common fantasy beasties.

57688.name: Dare
57688.description:
Publisher's description:

The pulp adventure genre is full of exciting tales of larger than life characters, set in the 1920s-40s. What if you had pulp adventurers in the modern day? That is, modern people who somehow get turned into pulp heroes. Then the game is about two things:


First, of course, they have thrilling adventures.
Second, the conflict between their pulpiness and their lives in the modern world where self-reliance and decisive action are the exception, not the rule.


Dare adds rules for the distinctive self-confidence of pulp characters, which can carry them through or get them into trouble; pulp schticks; and strains from normal life that can interrupt their adventures.

57691.description:
“800 Heroes: Defense of Sihang Warehouse" is a postcard wargame about the defense of Shihang Warehouse during Oct.27 to Nov.1 in 1937.
See wikipedia article.

Lieutenant Colonel Xie Jinyuan led over 400 soldiers to fight against the invasion of Imperial Japanese Army and covered the retreating of the Chinese force at the end of the Shanghai Battle. This successful defense provided a morale-lifting consolation to the Chinese army and drew the international support to Chinese government. Those brave soldiers have been called "800 Heroes".
57691.name: 800 Heroes: Defense of Sihang Warehouse

57693.name: Happenstance
rpgseries: The Decline and Fall of Xeverus Cosmetics
57693.description:
From the publishers website:

What could be simpler? Do a little research, play a little follow the leader and come home. The job is even easier when you've eyeballed the principals beforehand. But you know what they say about mice, men, shadowrunners and their carefully constructed plans.

57694.name: Backlash
57694.description:
From the publishers website:

Sometimes a run goes well. Other times it goes badly. Then, there are those times where you get caught up in the middle of someone else's run. Those you try really hard to forget. Good luck forgetting!

57695.name: Prodigal Son
rpgseries: The Decline and Fall of Xeverus Cosmetics
57695.description:
From the publisher website:

How does the old saying go? "Steal from me once, shame on you. Steal from me twice, shame on me?" How about the third or fourth time? How many times in a row can you steal the same thing from the same people and not get caught. Wanna find out?

57696.name: Hubris and Humility
57696.description:
From the publishers website:

The road to power has had its own set of hardships and now alliances must be reforged or broken. Be careful of which turn you take, be cause it can all come crashing down.

57697.name: Done Deal
57697.description:
From the publishers website:

The shadows have heated up, and it may be time to leave while you can. The question becomes, is it time to hold 'em or time to fold 'em?

57698.name: Späte Post
57698.description:
User summary

Späte Post (Late Mail) is a promotional adventure for Das Schwarze Auge. It was a loose insert to Mephisto No. 43.

80 years before the adventure, a bandit chief betrayed his band and had to flee. During his escape, he bade an elven maid to deliver the key to his cave cave to his son. 80 years later, the forgetful elf keeps her promise, but soon after that the grand-son of the bandit vanishes during a great fire in his village. Did he commit arson to cover his tracks or was he found by the descendants of the other bandits?

The adventure contains a tactical mini-game in which the characters have to battle the flames and preserve the harvest of the village.

rpgitemversion: Le Voyage de l'Effroi Soft Cover
57699.name: Voyage of Terror
57699.description:
From the back of the book:

Avalon is under attack. The Saxon hordes are advancing against the kingdom and the magic sword Excalibur, defender of the realm, has vanished. But a freak accident of Merlin’s magic transport you to ancient Greece - far from the desperate battle against the invaders...

Cast adrift aboard a vessel of dazzling gold and stripped of your weapons and magic spells, you must confront a host of hideous enemies. Can you overcome the gigantic, one-eyed Cyclops, the loathsome Harpy, the hammer-wielding Vulcan, and the animated corpse of a rotting mummy - and then navigate your way through Time back to Avalon?

57700.name: Tomb of Nightmares
57700.description:
From the back cover:

"You’ll love this job," said Merlin. "No danger at all. None of that saving the world business. It’ll be a piece of cake."

Why then does a terrible foreboding overwhelm you as you enter the the underground labyrinth of Grott’s Tomb to do Merlin’s little favour? Why is your path blocked by the horrific Draculina, fangs at the ready? Why are there more monsters, and deadlier traps here than in any of your previous adventures?

What is Merlin’s real purpose in sending you unprepared into the appalling Tomb of Nightmares? And will you survive long enough to find out?

rpgitemversion: Le marais de l'angoisse / Le convoi dans le marais des brumes
57701.name: Der Zug durch das Nebelmoor / Die Sümpfe des Lebens
57701.description:
Translated from the back:
You have a hard time surviving in Aventuriens swamps - regardless if you travel alone or in a group.

This double adventure one group the other solitaire features the two winners of the adventure author contest.

57702.name: Monopoly: Family Game Night Championship Edition
57702.description:
From Hasbro Press Release: MONOPOLY has been a family favorite for generations. But for families that can’t get enough of the exciting tournament action, MONOPOLY: Family Game Night Championship Edition allows families to run their own nail-biting competitions. Available in October (2009) to coincide with the World Championships, the game includes tournament rules, score sheets and a coveted trophy for the top family MONOPOLY Player to keep - glitzy dice and gold- and silver-toned houses and hotels complete the Vegas feel.

Also includes a speed die for a faster, more intense game of MONOPOLY!

57704.name: Rückkehr der Finsternis
57704.description:
User summary:

Rückkehr der Finsternis (Return of Darkness) is the first book of the Die Sieben Gezeichneten campaign (The Seven Marked Ones). It compiles the original adventures Alptraum ohne Ende, Unsterbliche Gier, and Grenzenlose Macht into a single volume. It also adds a campaign overview, pre-generated characters, and background information.

Warning: Spoilers ahead!

The campaign is suitable for characters starting with roughly 5000 points of experience. They start at a fair in Baliho from where they set out to investigate the burning of a priest of Tsa by a mob in the small village of Dragenfeld. They compete with a group of Prios followers and an inspector of the secret police. Arriving in Dragenfeld the adventurers find the village destroyed and the surrounding lands withered. The temple of Tsa has been desecrated by an evil wizard. When he is destroyed, the characters find out that they have been moments too late. The spirit of the long-dead Borbarad has been released into the world to wreak havoc in the following adventures. At the end of the events, the eye of one of the characters changes into a glowing red ruby which makes him the first of the Marked Ones. This concludes the first adventure Alptraum ohne Ende (Endless Nightmare).

The second adventure is Unsterbliche Gier (Immortal Craving). It seems at first not related to the events of Alptraum ohne Ende. The adventurers are called to the duchy of Weiden where they reveal and fight an infestation of vampires. It was caused by the dark elf Pardona in her attempt to steal enough life force to form a new body for Borbarad's spirit. At the climax of the adventure, the characters battle Pardona and the arch vampire Walmir von Riebeshoff in their sinister tower, and one of the characters becomes the second Marked One.

Grenzenlose Macht (Infinite Might) leads the characters to the ravaged city of Greifenfurt. They are hired by the monastery of Arras de Mott to investigate and prevent acts of sabotage that jeopardize the reconstruction of the monastery. Unknown to them, the head of the monks was replaced by a shapechanging demon that tries to build a portal to the Valley of Elements and a focus for magical energy. In the valley, Borbarad wants to create his new staff from Seelenstamm, a gigantic ancient tree. The attacks on the monastery are masterminded by Archon Megalon, a druid the characters may have encountered before and whom they will not remember with joy. After some events in the monastery, the arrival of the inquisition will force the characters to escape and enter the Valley of Elements, where they battle Borbarad's minions. They come back to Arras de Mott to destroy the astral focus. Here they meet the first time with the real Borbarad who bathes in the magical energy. The destruction of the astral focus delays Borbarad's plans, but also destroys the monastery, which is the end of this third adventure.

57705.name: Die Schwarze Sichel
57705.description:
Translated from the back:
Down in the valleys of the 'Schwarze Sichel' (Black Sickle) it is not so dangerous as the name of the mountain range suggests. So why shouldn't you - unhurriedly stroll down to the forest tavern to meet your buddies? You don't need to leave the forest track if you're not up to adventures, mysterious subterranian lakes or magical treasures.

57706.name: Catching Breath
57706.description: Adventure description from first page "A friend in need calls upon a group of heroes to help him deal with problems in a far-off land. These troubles, however, may be ones that even the bravest and experienced of adventurers are not equipped to handle. A roleplaying-intensive, one-round Living Greyhawk core adventure set in the Sultanate of Zeif for characters level 1-15 (APLs 2-16)"

57707.name: Tri 3D
57707.description:
The ultimate 3D strategy board game.
The game is played on a unique 3-tier triangular board, and players capture their opponent's pieces by surrounding or cornering them.
It is similar to games like draughts but not as complex as chess. The ability to jump between the 3 levels adds a whole new dimension to traditional board game play.
It is both easy to learn for beginners, but can be challenging and addictive to more experienced players.

57708.name: Die Götter des Schwarzen Auges
57708.description:
User summary:

Die Götter des Schwarzen Auges (The Gods of the Dark Eye) is a 2nd edition supplement describing the Twelve Gods and their priests, the evil Nameless One, and the gods and religious views of several smaller cultures and races. It includes rules for creating and playing priest characters. Priests are able to call upon their gods to perform miracles.

This book was replaced by Götter, Magier und Geweihte in the 3rd edition of Das Schwarze Auge and Wege der Götter in 4th edition.

57709.name: Riddle of the Dust
57709.description: Adventure description from front page "The Stonelands - all that remains of the proud Duchy of Tenh. A mystery haunts these barrens, one that promises rebirth for a fallen people. An adventure for characters of Average Party Level 2-10."

57710.name: Norwegian Style
rpghonor: 2009 Indie RPG Awards - Game of the Year - Runner Up
rpg: In the Belly of the Whale
57710.description:
An anthology of Norwegian role-playing games.

From the back of the book:
In this book you will find a number of role-playing games written by Norwegian designers. They vary in length, form and content from 15-minute poems to year-long campaigns, from GM-less freeform to competitive resource management games, from light-hearted fantasy slapstick to grimly realistic stories of patricide.

They have only one thing in common. They are Norwegian Style.

Expect to be challenged.

57711.name: Dragon (Issue 73 - May 1983)
rpgissuearticle: A rare way of viewing the wish: High level help comes once in a lifetime
Castles by Carroll V: Leeds Castle
The Ecology of the Catoblepas (or, looks can be very deceiving)
From the Sorceror's Scroll - The Inner Planes: A new way to look at the AD&D world
Game Review: 'Dragonmaster' - A classy-looking card game
Game Review: 'Grav Armor': A game to give tanks for
Game Review: 'Moon Base Clavius' is too basic
Non-violent Magic Items: One hundred ways to keep players guessing
Patching the cracks in Champions: From creating a character to keeping a job
The Duelist: A chaotic non-player character who likes to make people pay
The solo scenario: One-player parties are fun for two
The whole half-ogre: Ideas for finishing what EGG started
Thief's climb should be leveled out
Time, Money, FILE 13, and the Goon Show (not necessarily in that order)
Up on a Soapbox: All for all, not one for one
When it gets hit, it gets hurt: A system for equipment damage
57711.description:
Vol. VII No. 11 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art by Susan Collins.

This issue featured Forest of Doom, first place winner of the Module Design Contest, category A-2 (AD&D, levels 4-7).

rpgitemversion: La Horde des Démons - Gallimard edition
57713.name: Fire*Wolf
57713.description:
From the back cover:

Fire*Wolf, an outcast from his village, alone and near death, is saved by a hermit. His price is the rescue of his daughter from her captivity in the Far Kingdom. The quest is a perilous one. Fire*Wolf is forced to become involved in the great battle between hereditary enemies. The danger from the dreaded Demonspawn is now at its height.

Only you can decide the fate of Fire*Wolf. With your dice, you must choose which options Fire*Wolf should take and face the consequences.

57714.name: The Crypts of Terror
57714.description:
From the back cover:

Fire*Wolf, exiled from his Barbarian village, has inherited both his unknown father’s name, Lorn Xandine, but also - unwillingly - his role as a sorcerer. He must also face his father’s enemies. He will need all his skill, and his father’s spells, if he is to survive and successfully combat the most dreaded foes on earth: the Demonspawn.

Standing in the ruins of Belgardium, Fire*Wolf knows that his most dangerous adventure is only just starting. Only you can decide whether he will be truimpant or perish.

57715.name: Demondoom
57715.description:
From the back cover:

King Voltar’s violent death has shaken the realm, which has lost its one protector. Fire*Wolf, now a member of the Ruling Council, knows that ten years of peace have ended and that the hellish Demonspawn are at work again, plotting devilish destruction. Only the mighty Golden Orb, with its treacherous magical powers, can vanquish the old menace forever.

But Fire*Wolf’s terrifying quest takes him into the heart of the Spawn’s foul caverns - and into his greatest test of skill and strength. You alone can decide whether he will triumph - or meet a horrifying end...

rpgitemversion: Le Radici del Male - Italian version
57716.name: Ancient Evil
57716.description:
From the back cover:

The Demonspawn have been wiped out, but some of the land’s most prominent people are mysteriously disappearing. Fire*Wolf, in love with his beautiful young bride, is blind to the portents of doom.

But when the princess is seized, Fire*Wolf realizes that Harn is beset by evil - the prey of ancient sorcerers preparing for war. Fire*Wolf alone must fight this last, cosmic battle against the forces of darkness. He alone can save his people from destruction. Upon your decisions rest Fire*Wolf’s victory or failure - and the fate of his world.

57718.name: Armageddon Introductory Pack
57718.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Armageddon demo pack. Here you will find everything you need to begin playing the acclaimed game of modern magic and dark secrets. Simply read through this material, get your friends together, scrounge up some gaming dice (a four-sided (D4), a six-sided (D6), an eight-sided (D8), and a ten-sided (D10) die), and you are ready to play.

We hope you enjoy your introduction to CJ Carella’s Armageddon roleplaying game. Further information on the Armageddon line of products can be found at the end of this demo pack, or by visiting www.edenstudios.net/armageddon.

57719.name: Witchcraft Introductory Pack
57719.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the demo pack for CJ Carella’s WitchCraft roleplaying game from Eden Studios. Here you will find everything you need to begin playing the acclaimed game of modern magic and dark secrets. Just read through this material, gather some friends together, scrounge up some gaming dice (a four-sided (D4), a six-sided (D6), an eight-sided (D8), and a ten-sided (D10) die), and you are ready to play.

We hope you enjoy your introduction to CJ Carella’s WitchCraft roleplaying game. Further information on Eden Studios and the WitchCraft line of products can be found by visiting www.edenstudios.net/witchcraft.

57720.name: Dragon (Issue 72 - Apr 1983)
rpgissuearticle: Castles by Carroll IV: The Tower of London
Everything we think you need to know about sex in the AD&D world
From the Sorceror's Scroll: The chivalrous cavalier
A new name? It's elementary! - Old English makes a meaningful source
Off the Shelf: Good books galore, old and new
Tasteless Song of the Month: Valley Elf
The PBM scene: Facts you can use when YOU choose what game to play
The Role of Books, Part Three: Exploring some map manuals
Up on a Soapbox - Level titles don't do justice: They aren't used much, and aren't useful anyway
57720.description:
Vol. VII No. 10 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art by Clyde Caldwell.

This issue contained File 13 - the game of games - by Tom Wham, and a special section:

April comes and April goes...
...but fools live on forever

57721.name: Im Spinnenwald
57721.description:
User summary:

Im Spinnenwald (In the Spider Forest) is an adventure for 3-6 characters of levels 1-3. It is the first part of the Die Erforschung des Orklandes campaign.

The Orkland is one of the last white spots on the map of Aventurien. Orcish bands come down from the mountains surrounding this region from time to time to raid the surrounding villages and take slaves, but almost no one from the civilized lands has set a foot on orcish soil. Now the rulers of Thorwal send the characters to the Orkland to bring back detailed maps and and accounts of the creatures, people, and mysteries encountered.

This first adventure in the campaign is for most parts a free-form journey with some required and some optional encounters. A lair of mostly friendly lizardmen, a first encounter with a giant, and one with a dragon. When the characters enter the Spider Forest, they will find a (very) greedy dwarf and a tribe of sentient, telepathic giant spiders. The spider lair is the finale of the adventure.

57722.name: Machines and Mutants
57722.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Animal and Machine...

New Predators of a Shattered World

For more than a century, people played with genes like toys and made computers think and dream. Now, new species of plants and animals fill the places humanity once ruled. Things that were once machines and tools now prey on the descendants of their makers.

This creature compendium for the re-envisioned Gamma World contains full descriptions of many new monsters suitable for any d20 game. Machines & Mutants has a dozens of new species, including rules for playing non-human characters, and guidelines for building new mutations, revived extinct species and unique challenges. It also includes descriptions of electronic "species" as both monsters and characters, and expands the rules for solving technological mysteries.

Requires the use of the d20 Modern Roleplaying Game or Dungeons & Dragons Player’s Handbook. V.3.5, published by WOC.

57723.name: Old Hate
57723.description:
User Summary: Downloadable adventure for Witchcraft.

From the introduction:

This scenario is intended to introduce new characters to the world of C. J. Carella's WitchCraft, published by Eden Studios. Since this scenario is intended as an introduction to the supernatural, Bast, Spirits, Vampires, and characters already well versed in the mystical arts are inappropriate. Ideally, the characters should be humans who possess little real knowledge of the occult. Over the course of the adventure, the characters will discover they possess supernatural abilities and use them to destroy a lingering evil.

57727.name: Der Purpurturm
57727.description:
(Translation from the back of the book):
In this second part of the "Discovery of the Orkland"-series, the heroes are confronted with a gruesome building: The Purpurturm ("Purple Tower"). In its interior precious infos are hidden that the adventurers will need to find the fabled, divine treasure they are after since they left the town of Thorwal.

Additional user information:

Der Purpurturm is an adventure for 3-6 characters of levels 1-4. It is the second part of the Die Erforschung des Orklandes campaign.

The first part of the adventure is a series of encounters during the journey through the Orkland. The main encounters are a unicorn, a wise woman, and a giant that imprisons the characters in his cave. The second part is a visit to a Grolm village (grolms being a kind of gnome), that ultimately leads to the Purple Tower, basically a riddle dungeon that is the finale of this adventure.

57728.name: Der Orkenhort
57728.description:
(translation from the back of the book)
In the third and last part of the "discovery of the Orkland" series the mysteries are solved: The Orkenhort houses one of the biggest and most precious treasures of Aventurien. But the way is dotted with grave dangers which can only be mastered with creativity.

Additional user information:

Der Orkenhort is an adventure for 3-6 characters of levels 2-5. It is the third and last part of the Die Erforschung des Orklandes campaign.

The previous adventures have brought the characters deep into the orcish lands. Now they discover the city of Ohort and their inhabitants, the Holberker. Those are not quite orks, and the players will be able to find out the history of this settlement. From Ohort, the path of the adventurers leads to the Orkenhort, an ancient, trap-riddled temple dedicated to Phex, the god of merchants and thieves.

57729.name: Meister der Dämonen
rpgissuearticle: Seltsame Schiffe im Golf von Perricum
57729.description:
User summary:

Meister der Dämonen (Demon Master) is the second book of the Die Sieben Gezeichneten campaign (The Seven Marked Ones). It compiles the original adventures Pforte des Grauens and Bastrabuns Bann into a single volume, and adds a new adventure: Schatten im Zwielicht. It also presents background information and ideas for additional adventures.

Warning: Spoilers ahead!

The first adventure in the book is Pforte des Grauens (Portal of Dread). After Borbarad's temporary defeat, the characters head to Punin, where they are sent to investigate the theft of large amounts of the magic metal Endurium on the isle of Maraskan. The metal should have been transported to Punin, but never arrived. The sea voyage from Khunchom to Tuzak goes not as expected and the party is stranded on the Maraskan shores north of their destination. They have to find their way through the jungles where they meet Achaz, the lizardmen. The Achaz want the characters to return an artifact that was robbed from them, a mission they can accept or decline.

After days in the jungle, the party finds the Endurium mine, human sacrifices and a demon that is forced to mine the Endurium ore.
